intro: Steiractis, commonly known as the sea hare, is a marine gastropod mollusk belonging to the family Aplysiidae. It is characterized by its soft, often colorful body and the presence of a distinctive, sac-like mantle. Steiractis species are typically found in shallow coastal waters and are known for their ability to secrete a variety of chemicals. Their anatomy includes a reduced shell and a muscular foot used for movement. These organisms play an important role in marine ecosystems through their feeding habits and interactions with other species.
